item.title: Preventing encoding issues with mysqldump
item.description: Take the good old command: mysqldump -u user -p database > dump.sql the above command is simple and effective but it doesn’t care about encodings and redirects the output to a file instead of to standard output. This can lead to all sorts of encoding issues because of the local settings on the operating system and in the database. To make the command care about encodings we can use the following options:
